definitions.definition: a person who has an important job as a manager of a company or an organization

examples.text: a **senior/top executive** in a computer firm
a junior executive at an ad agency
One TV network executive has already called for more deregulation.
contracts to prevent the loss of key executives
one of the most successful TV executives around
He's a senior executive in a computer firm.
They offer English courses to business executives.

definitions.definition: a group of people who run a company or an organization

examples.text: The union’s executive has/have yet to reach a decision.
She is a member of the party's national executive.
She was on the executive of the Women's Social and Political Union.

definitions.definition: the part of a government responsible for putting laws into effect

examples.text: Conservatives are by tradition believers in a strong executive.
Parliament's ability to control the executive
The Executive is/are set to meet again on 22 December.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from medieval Latin executivus, from exsequi, from ex- ‘out’ + sequi ‘follow’.
